Build: 3.3 M4

I had an "out of handles" error while running this build (stack below).  Looking quickly at the code for AnimatedTabItem, I don't see an obvious leak, but it does seem strange that each tab item has its own array of 16 images for the animation.  If I have a large number of views and editors open that perform animation (such as compare editors), this will quickly consume a lot of handles.  It seems ike a JFace ResourceManager should be used so that each tab doesn't need its own image array.

Exception in thread "Timer-206" org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3476)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3373)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3344)
        at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.getImageData(Image.java:841)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.presentations.defaultpresentation.AnimatedTab Item$1.run(AnimatedTabItem.java:197)
        at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:527)
        at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:477)
We should reuse these as a static set of images as we do this everywhere.
This will be addressed when we move to the animation manager Eric is working on.
We have removed this in M5.
